page.title: 07PINHOE VILLAGE:HOUSING.
page.content: Pinhoe is a village of about one square kilometre but is now a suburb of Exeter. There are 6 properties over 200 years old.To the south towards the station there are terraced houses built over 100 years ago.The main road shops and two nearby roads are semi-detached 1930 homes. Most of Pinhoe was built in the last 30 years. The occupants are mainly house owners.There is a small council estate to the North West.There are about 1500 houses and a population of around 5000. These newer houses are built of brick and slate.They usually have 3 bedrooms,bathroom,upstairs and downstairs toilets,kitchen,lounge,dining-room garage,and garden.
